sen.j: 初めて日本酒を作って神々に献じた酒造の祖神である酒解神（さかとけのかみ。オオヤマツミ）、およびその御子神である酒解子神（さかとけごのかみ。コノハナノサクヤビメ）、その夫の大若子神（おおわくごのかみ。ニニギ）、孫の小若子神（こわくごのかみ。ホオリ）を主祭神として本殿に祀る。
sen.e: The main deities enshrined within the main building are Sakatoke-no-Kami (Oyamatsumi) - the father of rice-wine manufacturing who first made Japanese sake and offered it to the gods, who is enshrined with his daughter Sakatokego-no-Kami (Konohanano Sakuya Bime) and her husband Owakugo-no-Kami (Ninigi), and his grandson Kowakugo-no-Kami (Hoori).

sen.j: 相殿に嵯峨天皇、その子の仁明天皇、嵯峨天皇の后の橘嘉智子（檀林皇后）、橘嘉智子の父の橘清友を祀る。
sen.e: The aidono building enshrines the subordinate deities Emperor Saga, his son Emperor Ninmyo, his wife TACHIBANA no Kachiko (Empress Danrin) and her father TACHIBANA no Kiyotomo.

sen.j: 檀林皇后が当社の砂を産屋に敷きつめて仁明天皇を産んだことから、子授け・安産の神としても信仰されるようになった。
sen.e: Umenomiya-taisha Shrine came to be worshipped for conception and smooth childbirth after Empress Danrin spread sand from the shrine on the floor of the delivery room in which she gave birth to Emperor Ninmyo.

sen.j: 県犬養三千代により橘氏一門の氏神として山城国相楽郡に創建されたのに始まる。
sen.e: Umenomiya-taisha Shrine originated with a shrine founded for the ujigami (guardian deity) of the Tachibana clan in Sagara County, Yamashiro Province by Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo.

sen.j: 平城京への遷都の際に、県犬養三千代の娘である光明皇后と牟漏女王によって奈良に遷座し、さらに木津川の上流に遷座した。
sen.e: The shrine was moved to Nara by Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo's daughters Empress Komyo and Murono Okimi when the capital city was relocated to Heijo-kyo, and was again moved further up Kizu-gawa River.

sen.e: When the capital was relocated to Heian-kyo, the shrine was moved to its current location by Empress Danrin of the Tachibana clan.

sen.j: 『延喜式』では名神大社に列し、仁明天皇の外戚の氏神として二十二社にも列した。
sen.e: The Jinmyocho (Register of Deities) of the Engishiki (procedures of the Engi era) classifies the shrine as a Myojin Taisha and it became included as one of the Twenty-Two Shrines as an ujigami of the maternal relatives of Emperor Ninmyo.
